text:
quote from bug 39300:

as far as I can see, there the problem shouldn't happen
anymore that command-line-args are eaten by the classpath, but only because it
is impossible to reach :runAntWithClasspath or :runAntWithJikesAndClasspath
where the error occurs in the current ant.bat, which is another, new introduced,
bug.

[quote]
:runAnt
if "%_USE_CLASSPATH%"=="no" goto runAntNoClasspath

:runAntNoClasspath
"%_JAVACMD%" %ANT_OPTS% -classpath "%ANT_HOME%\lib\ant-launcher.jar"
"-Dant.home=%ANT_HOME%" org.apache.tools.ant.launch.Launcher %ANT_ARGS%
%ANT_CMD_LINE_ARGS%
rem Check the error code of the Ant build
if not "%OS%"=="Windows_NT" goto onError
set ANT_ERROR=%ERRORLEVEL%
goto end

:runAntWithClasspath
"%_JAVACMD%" %ANT_OPTS% -classpath "%ANT_HOME%\lib\ant-launcher.jar"
"-Dant.home=%ANT_HOME%" org.apache.tools.ant.launch.Launcher %ANT_ARGS% -cp
"%CLASSPATH%" %ANT_CMD_LINE_ARGS%
rem Check the error code of the Ant build
if not "%OS%"=="Windows_NT" goto onError
set ANT_ERROR=%ERRORLEVEL%
goto end
[/quote]

if "%_USE_CLASSPATH%"=="no" goto runAntNoClasspath
jumps to :runAntNoClasspath, ok, but if "%_USE_CLASSPATH%"=="yes" then it just
goes on to the next line which is also :runAntNoClasspath.
Same goes for the Jikes-variants
creator: mbenson@apache.org
